definition: to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

pinyin: wu4 ru4 qi2 tu2 xiao4 ying4

sentences.english: Desire. It's an emotion designed to lead us astray.
sentences.chinese: 慾望，是誘惑我們誤入歧途的情感。

sentences.english: She went to Paris to bring back her errant son.
sentences.chinese: 她到巴黎去把誤入歧途的兒子領回來。

sentences.english: But halos also can lead investors astray.
sentences.chinese: 然而，光環也能讓投資者誤入歧途。

sentences.english: She was a woman ganging a wee bit gleed in her walk through the world.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個在世間誤入歧途的女子。

sentences.english: To attribute the rise and fall of the economy to their spending puts the relationship backward.
sentences.chinese: 經濟學家誤入歧途將經濟的升降同開支扯上關係。

sentences.english: I used notes lest faulty memory should lead me astray.
sentences.chinese: 我翻閱了所做的筆記，免得記錯了而使我誤入歧途。

sentences.english: His passion for horseracing carried him astray.
sentences.chinese: 他對賽馬運動的酷愛使他誤入歧途。

sentences.english: To put it bluntly: if we miss the poor, we miss the point.
sentences.chinese: 坦率地說，如果我們錯過窮人，我們就會誤入歧途。

sentences.english: Even the best model can be sidetracked by false premises.
sentences.chinese: 甚至最好的模型，也會因爲錯誤的前提而誤入歧途。

definition: to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
